p: Viral myocarditis (VMC) is a disorder that affects the myocardiocytes following a viral infection and can progress into dilated cardiomyopathy and heart failure in young adults [ 1]. Coxsackievirus B3 (CVB3), a member of the Enterovirus genus of Picornaviridae, is well-identified as the dominant etiological factor causing viral myocarditis. It was reported that about 25â€“27% cases of dilated cardiomyopathy and VMC in young adults and children were caused by CVB3 [ 2, 3]. Although type-I interferon is reported to have certain therapeutic effect, the treatment or vaccine has been successful in treating CVB3 infection and myocarditis [ 4, 5].
